title: Apollo 8 was the first mission to orbit the Moon

images.description: The prime crew of Apollo 8:  James A. Lovell, Jr. (CMP), William A. Anders (LMP) and Frank Borman (CMDR) beside Apollo Mission Simulator at KSC
Apollo 8 commander Frank Borman is shown during suiting for a simulated flight in the KSC altitude chamber with spacecraft 103
Apollo 8 commander Frank Borman dons his helmet in preparation for a simulated flight in the KSC altitude chamber with spacecraft 103
Apollo 8 CMP James Lovell is shown suited for a simulated flight in the KSC altitude chamber with spacecraft 103
Apollo 8 CMP James A. Lovell is shown suited for a simulated flight in the KSC altitude chamber with spacecraft 103
Apollo 8 LMP William A. Anders is shown suited in preparation for a simulated flight in the KSC altitude chamber with spacecraft 103
Apollo 8 LMP William A. Anders is shown suited in preparation for a simulated flight in the KSCaltitude chamber with spacecraft 103

Astronaut William A. Anders, Lunar Module pilot for NASA's first manned Apollo/Saturn V space flight, the Apollo 8 mission is shown suited inpreparation for a simulated flight in th e altitude chamber with the Spacecraft 103.
Astronauts James A. Lovell, Jr. and William A. Anders suited in preparation for a simulated flight in the altitude chamber with Spacecraft 103
Technicians assist Apollo 8 commander Frank Borman into spacecraft 103 for a simulated altitude chamber test at KSC
Erection of the Apollo Service Module in High Bay #3
(description not yet available)
Apollo spacecraft 103 is mated to instrument unit atop SA-503 (Apollo 8)
the crew of Apollo 8 poses as their moon rocket rolls out of the Vehicle Assembly Building
Apollo 8 astronauts at Apollo 8 rollout
Fish-eye view of Apollo 8's Saturn V space vehicle being rolled out.
Apollo 8 crew is photographed in Building 4 a MSC, where they are participating in classroom work in burn test review and procedures review
close of Frank Borman prior to Apollo 8 flight

Apollo 8 Astronauts (l-r) Frank Borman, James Lovell, and William Anders walk from the KSC's Manned Spacecraft Operations Building to the transfer van which took them to Launch Complex 39's pad A for emergency egress testing
